subprocess_flow.description: Collect employee performance data from various sources, including performance reviews, project reports, and 360-degree feedback. Ensure data is anonymized where necessary to comply with privacy regulations. Consolidate the data into a structured format suitable for GenAI analysis.

Utilize GenAI to analyze the consolidated performance data and identify skill gaps across different employee groups and roles. GenAI compares current skill levels against required competencies for their positions and future organizational needs. The analysis should highlight areas where employees need additional training or development.

HR Manager reviews the preliminary skill gap analysis generated by GenAI. Validate the identified skill gaps with department heads and team leads to ensure accuracy and relevance. Incorporate feedback from managers to refine the analysis and identify any additional skill gaps not captured by GenAI.

Based on the validated skill gaps, identify relevant training resources, including internal training programs, external courses, online learning platforms, and mentorship opportunities. Evaluate the quality and suitability of each training resource to ensure it meets the specific needs of the employees. Compile a catalog of recommended training programs.

Use GenAI to match employees with the most relevant training programs based on their individual skill gaps, learning preferences, and career goals. GenAI generates personalized training recommendations for each employee, considering factors such as learning style, availability, and previous training history. Ensure recommendations align with budget constraints and regulatory requirements.

Communicate the personalized training recommendations to employees and their managers. Provide clear instructions on how to access and enroll in the recommended training programs. Offer support and guidance to employees throughout the training process. Address any questions or concerns regarding the training recommendations.

HR facilitates the training and development opportunities for employees. This includes scheduling training sessions, coordinating logistics, and providing necessary resources. Monitor employee participation and progress in the training programs. Collect feedback from employees on the effectiveness of the training.

Evaluate the effectiveness of the training programs by measuring improvements in employee skills, performance, and job satisfaction. Use data from performance reviews, project outcomes, and employee surveys to assess the impact of the training. Identify areas for improvement in the training programs and adjust future training plans accordingly.
